item.title: Berkeley Earth raises concerns about air pollution in China
item.description:
Source: Berkeley Earth website. A recent study published in PLOS ONE by Berkeley Earth reveals that air pollution causes approximately 4,000 deaths per day in China, representing 17% of the country’s total deaths. This non-profit organization, established to investigate concerns raised by global warming skeptics, determined that the air quality for 38% of China’s population would be deemed “unhealthy” by United States standards.
